hu.elte.txtuml.api

Class ExternalClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.elte.txtuml.api.ExternalClass
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Timer, Timer.Handle

    public class ExternalClass
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for external classes in the model. External classes are those which's implementation is not part of the model, and from the scope of the model they function as black boxes. They might be used to bring external features into the model or to communicate with components of the program that are not part of the model.

    By the current implementation, external classes are not exported to EMF-UML2, with the exception of standard library classes Timer and Timer.Handle. The planned design is to include all external classes in the model with an 'external' stereotype and empty operations.

    Represents: external class

    Usage:

    From outside the model, use external classes according to the rules and conventions of the Java language. The only restriction is that an external class may not be abstract because that could cause problems during model execution or exportation. From inside the model, use them as any passive model class (that is, one that may not react to any asynchronous events). Call its methods as operations or use its fields as attributes. All its fields used from inside the model must be of a type extending ModelValue. Also all parameter and return types of methods called from inside the model must extend ModelValue.

    As the txtUML API uses its own thread for model execution, external classes probably need synchronization.

    When a method of an external class is called from the model (on the model's executor thread), it can call back to methods of model classes, get or set fields before it returns. However, if it is called from a different thread, it may only communicate with the model through signals or by creating new model objects, as it might be done from anywhere outside the model. For details about managing the model from outside, see the documentation of Model.

    In case of primitive values, this class has specific protected methods to convert ModelType objects back to their raw value (the primitive values represented by them). These methods may only be used to convert data gained from the model for an external component. If any data is sent back to the model, it must be in the form of ModelType objects.

    Java restrictions:

    • Instantiate: disallowed
    • Define subtype: allowed

      Subtype requirements:

      • none

      Subtype restrictions:

      • Be abstract: disallowed
      • Generic parameters: allowed
      • Constructors: allowed
      • Initialization blocks: allowed
      • Fields: allowed
      • Methods: allowed
      • Nested interfaces: allowed
      • Nested classes: allowed
      • Nested enums: allowed
    • Inherit from the defined subtype: allowed

    See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

    Author:
    Gabor Ferenc Kovacs
